text:
When calculating the geometric mean for a returns data set, it is necessary to add 1 to
each value under the radical and then subtract 1 from the result. The geometric mean
return (RG) can be computed using the following equation:
1+RG = /(1+R)x(1+R2)X...X(1+R)
where:
R = the return for period t
Example: Geometric mean return
For the last three years, the returns for Acme Corporation common stock have been
-9.34%, 23.45%, and 8.92%. Compute the compound annual rate of return over the
3-year period.
